answers.answer: I would have her checked by a doctor. One thing that comes to mind is Diabetes but I'm sure there's lots of plausible reasons.

Does she drink a lot in the summer warm days we are supposed to drink more liquids preferably water,it would make her go more .Is she well otherwise no other symptoms , does she 'go' a lot at school aswell as at home ?

Any other symptoms?Please don't be scared at what I suggest.She needs to be checked for diabetes.She could have some kind of lowgrade infection w/o pain.I am diabetic and if my blood sugar gets high I drink more then usual and pee more also.Please bring her for a check up.You know when my son was little, now that I think, I thought he had diabetes.Nope, he just drank a LOT.

question: what does it mean if my 5 year old has the feeling of constantly needing to pass urine but there is no stinging or burning feeling as passing
title: my daughters symptom
